p: The crystalline structure of the powders was characterized by X-ray diffraction; the patterns obtained are shown in Figure 11. The powders annealed at 600 °C under argon and at oxygen partial pressures 10 −4 bar exhibit a low degree of crystallization and their XRD patterns can be indexed in the Pm-3m cubic space group. Powders annealed at a p(O 2) higher than 10 −3 bar crystallized with the monoclinic structure. This set of data indicates that at a fixed annealing temperature, the annealing atmosphere greatly influences the crystal structure of the synthesized particles.
